name: Hotel Wolf-Dietrich

reviews.text: The family rooms are great--huge, with play area, etc. Couldn't find a better hotel for traveling with kids. Also, great location...right in the middle of the "old" part of Salzburg where you can walk to everything. We were very happy with this choice. The staff was also remarkably helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; perfect for families...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our time at this hotel. The service was remarkable, and the breakfast buffet was scrumptious! The hotel is centrally located near Old Town, and is surrounded by some very nice shops. We got the true experience of the Alps.
reviews.title: Wow! What a treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not ask more for my stay in Salzburg. Wolf Dietrich is a beautiful hotel placed in a pedestrian area, just 10 min walking from the Altstadt. My room was a small double room on the ground floor, in the Altstadt hotel (the main building, where the reception is placed). The position of that room is perfect as you can reach the breakfast room as well as the SPA with few steps. The room was tidy and clean, and spacious enough. Furthermore the staff very kind and the service complete. The SPA includes swimming pool, sauna, steam bath, infrared lamp and relax room, perfect for some relax! the water in the pool sometimes was not extremely warm and often staff was not in the SPA area, anyway the overall opinion is good. To conclude I would recommend Wolf Dietrich as, in my case, I had an excellent stay for a low cost (low season, booked by internet without cancellation).
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Salzburg

reviews.text: Treated ourselves to a suite in the wolf Dietrich hotel.
reviews.title: Very luxurious room, awesome stay

reviews.text: Turned out to be on the top floor of a separate building across the street (3rd floor no elevator sadly).
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed at...

reviews.text: Charming little hotel with a beautiful spa ... alot of bang for your buck!!! The room was adequate size albeit the shower was small. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and plentiful. While I didn't see it, apparently it had a pool. The location was great. A 15 minute walk from the train station and admist lots of shopping. The sights are a 10 minute walk. Should I return to Salzburg, I would stay again!!! The hotel isn't well marked on the street.
reviews.title: Charming Salzburg Hotel

reviews.text: Great experience staying at Hotel Wolf-Dietrich. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We stayed in a family room in the Residence across from the main hotel. Although it was on the 4th floor (no elevator) it was worth the climb. It was very spacious with a living room on the main level with skylights and a very comfortable pullout couch and also had a full bath. There were stairs that led to a loft with bedroom & ensuite bathroom. Staff helped us with taking suitcases to our room (for a tip). Location is great...very close to a pedestrian only street lined with shops and restaurants, ending at a bridge which leads you to Old Town. Family of 4 from Canada.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Wolf-Dietrich. It is a lovely hotel with helpful service. The #4 bus stops at Wolf-Dietrich street, so you would walk 1.5 blocks to catch it to Old Town/Festival Hall and only .5 blocks returning. The front desk person can print you a schedule from that stop on request. It only takes about 6 minutes to Old Town. I would recommend one of the romantic rooms such as the Magic Flute room. It is unlike any room you have ever stayed in with blue sky carpet in the bed room; theater curtains all around, even framing the bedroom from the living area; star lights above the bed in arcs and in the bathroom ceiling; an elongated tub with the bath area separated by a dramatic curtain; a stereo system with sound that went into both rooms; paintings of Egyptian pyramids all around.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in New Town

reviews.text: The Wolf-Dietrich is a fantastic place to stay in Salzburg. There are so many positives; size of the room, location, amenities, staff...it was really a great experience. From the moment we checked in we were treated as special guests, not just another group paying for another room. The front desk staff was very helpful in giving us tips and pointing us in the right direction for things to do in the city.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a large selection of movies that can be borrowed if you need a couple of hours of downtime after touring the city.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very clean hotel, with very friendly and helpfull staff. Our room had most mode cons with a safe, mini bar, shower/bath and air conditioning. Serves buffet breakfast of scrambled egg bacon sausages plus assorted hams and cheeses, you also get free afternoon coffee and cake. The old town with its squares, shops and many restaurants is only 10 to 15 mins walk. The main rail station 20 mins at most. We used the panorama tours which pick you up from the hotel which is handy. The hotel also has a lovely spa and pool which is worth a visit especially after a days outing.
reviews.title: Music to the ears

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a couple in our 60s and found this place ideal and fully recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Convenient Location in Salzburg

reviews.text: The Wolf-Dietrich is a wonderful place to stay while in Salzburg. Just around the corner is a lovely pedestrian street that leads to Old Town. It's a nice walk, filled with interesting shops. We (retirees in our 60s) stayed in the main building, three steps down and five steps up. It was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice. There was a nice selection of items, and they were fresh and flavorful. It was warm in Salzburg during our visit, and the hotel gladly supplied us with a fan to move the air around.
reviews.title: Excellent room, staff and service!

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Wolf Dietrich as part of our family vacation to Germany and Austria. We stayed in one of the family rooms in the annex building just across the street. Our room was very clean, with 2 full bathrooms, 2 televisions, and 2 beds (one was a pullout couch bed though was very comfy for a pullout). There were 2 adults and one teen in our family. Though the outside of the building was covered with staging for work they were doing, we did not see any workers while we where there (Saturday thru Tuesday). The front desk, particularly Jorg, was extremely helpful. He booked all our tours for us. Additionally he gave us a great recommendation for dinner (Zwettlers in Old Town) where we had one of the best meals of our week in Austria and Germany. He also helped us with train schedules. The hotel pool and spa area was a great place for us to relax after being out touring and wandering around Salzburg all day. The afternoon tea and cake was a big hit with our teen. The buffet breakfast was excellent! We would absolutely recommend staying at the Wolf-Dietrich. The location is great. We walked everyplace we needed to go. Old Town is just a short walk across the river.
reviews.title: Cozy nice location and excellent value for money

reviews.text: My wife and me went to celebrate our 10th anniverssary and we really loved the hotel especially their cozy spa (don't miss it , it's totally free) also we were very happy with their suite (it's really romantic)
reviews.title: Don't stay in their building across the road right now!

reviews.text: The Wolf-Dietrich ticks our boxes - character, convenience, and true value for money. There's a quirky, comfortable flair to the shared areas ( a quick dip in the pool is a must!) and our rooms in the "residenz" were fantastic. They met the lengthy list of generous room size, pleasant decorative scheme, large flat screen TV, wifi (password simply offered, no additional charge); generous hanging spaces; shower/bath with good hot water and pressure; comfortable beds; thoughtful lighting; quiet location; and well heated. When you mix in a generous buffet breakfast, "drop in" afternoon tea (no charge), and excellent staff service, it's a very reasonably priced winner. You're about 7 minutes easy stroll (mainly down a cobbled street) to the old town. You're also on the right side of the river for the Mirabell Gardens, Mozart's residenz, and some lovely cafes and restaurants. All in all, we loved it.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: We had originally booked for two nights but circumstances changed this to one night. The only negative was that even with four weeks notice of the change the hotel still insisted on charging us for two nights - but to be fair it was a non refundable deal we had booked. Overall it was exactly what we needed for a family of five - plenty of space, complimentary afternoon tea, pool for a quick dip, and delicious breakfast. Of note were the breakfast staff who could not have been more friendly and helpful - they even set up a table of 5 in another room so we could sit together (it was busy and only tables of 2 were available). Location is quite good just a short walk to old town. In terms of rooms we had room 55 which was at top of a windy staircase with one other room - it would be amazing if you were a couple of families who booked both rooms because at the bottom of the stairs is a big playroom and kitchen that it looks like you could lock off and give the kids a big rumpus room to themselves. Overall pretty good.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good area

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residences over the new year's period for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is really good within walking distance to the old town but still located in a quiet part of town. Most of the reception staff is really nice and helpful with arrangements of day trips and so on. The hotel had warned us that our apartment was on the 4th floor and that no lift was available. The hotel staff did bring all our luggage all the way up and they expect to have a lift installed by July 2012 (may expect some noise from construction). The apartment itself is a bit dated and especially the bathroom is very small with a low ceiling. Overall a very pleasant stay with good value for money.
reviews.title: Good location, value for money

reviews.text: Staff very helpfully and flexible, went that little extra to help. Room was good and location is also good.
reviews.title: Perfect for a family of 5

reviews.text: If you appreciate the amenities a proper four-star city hotel offers, this is the place! Well located yet quiet (except for some daytime work on installin g an elevator in the annex across the street) the Wlf Dietrich is worth every Euro (we paid E120 per night for a triple) The only MINOR annoyance was a toliet location blocking the bathroom door...ouch if you don't lock the door! Bigscreen TV offers DVD which they offer you no charge at the desk. Pool and sauna were superb, very rare for a city center hotel. The strudel and coffe between 2:30 and 4pm (approx. times) are an added bonus, as are the english language newspapers and magazines. The tall young bellhop gladly toted our suitcases up three flights (again the annex WILL have a lift by spring 2012!) but the three flights of stairs we travelled were a nice little exercise to work off some of the sumptous breakfast foods we enjoyed!
reviews.title: Great location, price in otherwise pricey Salzburg

description: The Wolf-Dietrich Altstadthotel & Residenz is situated in the city centre of Salzburg and offers absolute comfort in a central location. It consists of two buildings, Altstadthotel and the Residenz, located opposite each other in a quiet side street of the city’s pedestrian area. No matter whether you are enjoying your family holiday in Salzburg, whether you are a loving couple, searching for culture and sightseeing or if you are on a business trip to this World Heritage Sight.
